meanings.definition: To talk or write about oneself excessively
meanings.sent1: She would egotize for hours, always bringing the conversation back to herself.
meanings.sent2: He tends to egotize in his blog posts, making them all about his personal experiences.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Mark couldn't help but egotize, turning every topic into a story about himself.
meanings.sent4: Her egotizing was like a loud trumpet, drowning out any chance for others to share their own stories.
meanings.sent5: The way she egotized made it seem like she was the only character in her own play.

meanings.definition: To focus excessively on oneself and one's own interests
meanings.sent1: When stressed, she would egotize and forget about everyone else's needs.
meanings.sent2: He tends to egotize, always putting his own desires above those of others.
meanings.sent3: In the game, the character would egotize, collecting all the treasures for himself.
meanings.sent4: His egotizing nature was like a black hole, sucking in all attention and leaving none for others.
meanings.sent5: The way he egotized made it seem like the world revolved around him.
